description: The IN3 segment contains additional insurance information for certifying the need for patient care.  Fields used by this segment are defined by HICFA or other regulatory agencies

fields.name: Set Id - Insurance Certification
fields.description: sequence number which uniquely identifies this segment for the purpose of adding, changing, or deleting a certification segment

fields.name: Certification Number
fields.description: assigned by the certification agency

fields.name: Certified By
fields.description: party that approved the certification

fields.name: Certification Required
fields.description: identifies whether certification is required.  Refer to table 0136 - Y/N indicator for valid values

fields.name: Penalty
fields.description: the penalty, in dollars or a percentage, that will be assessed if the pre-certification is not performed.  Refer to user-defined table 0148 - penalty type for suggested entries

fields.name: Certification Date / Time
fields.description: date and time stamp when insurance was certified to exist for the patient

fields.name: Certification Modify Date / Time
fields.description: date/time that the certification was modified

fields.name: Operator
fields.description: party that is responsible for sending this certification information

fields.name: Certification Begin Date
fields.description: date that this certification begins

fields.name: Certification End Date
fields.description: date that this certification ends

fields.name: Days
fields.description: number of days for which this certification is valid.  This field will apply to denied, pending, or approved days.  Refer to user-defined table 0149 - day type for suggested entries

fields.name: Non-concur Code / Description
fields.description: non-concur code and description for a denied request

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>.  Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Name or description of the item in question.  E.g., myocardial infarction or x-ray impression.  Its data type is string (ST).

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Each coding system will be assigned a unique identifier.  This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item.  For backward compatibility, if this component is absent, it will be taken to mean the CPT-4 with ASTM extensions, i.e., AS4.  Other coding systems that might appear here are ICD-9, ICD-10, SNOMED, etc.  Each system will be given a unique identifying string.  The current ASTM 1238-88  diagnostic/procedure/observation/drug ID/health outcomes coding systems are identified in the tables below.  Others may be added as needed.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system.  If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component.  If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally defined system

fields.name: Non-concur Effective Date / Time
fields.description: effective date of the non-concurrence classification

fields.name: Physician Reviewer
fields.description: physician who works with and reviews cases that are pending physician review for the certification agency

fields.name: Certification Contact
fields.description: name of the party contacted at the certification agency who granted the certification and communicated the certification number

fields.name: Certification Contact Phone Number
fields.description: phone number of the certification contact

fields.name: Appeal Reason
fields.description: reason an appeal was made on a non-concur for certification

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>.  Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text

fields.name: Certification Agency
fields.description: certification agency

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>.  Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Name or description of the item in question.  E.g., myocardial infarction or x-ray impression.  Its data type is string (ST).

fields.name: Certification Agency Phone Number
fields.description: phone number of the Certification agency

fields.name: Pre-certification Required / Window
fields.description: identifies whether pre-certification is required for particular patient types and the time window for obtaining the certification.  Refer to user-defined table 0150 - pre-certification patient type for suggested values.  Valid values for the pre-certification required component are found in table 0136 - Y/N indicator.  The pre-certification window is the amount of time needed to be certified from arrival at the institution.  Its format follows the time stamp (TS) data type rules

fields.name: Case Manager
fields.description: entity who/which is handling this particular patient's case (e.g., UR nurse, or a specific facility location).

fields.name: Second Opinion Date
fields.description: date that the second opinion was obtained

fields.name: Second Opinion Status
fields.description: Code that represents the status of the second opinion.  Refer to user-defined table 0151 - second opinion status for suggested values

fields.name: Second Opinion Documentation Received
fields.description: if accompanying documentation has been received by the provider.  Refer to table 0152 - second opinion documentation received

fields.name: Second Opinion Practitioner
fields.description: ID and name of the physician who provided the second opinion
